title: Getting a refund for a phone repair
content:
Long story short, I paid for a phone repair back on 06/17/2020 after I was told by a support agent that said they would refund me after I received my phone. Google lost my phone and replaced it, now I'm trying to get the refund for repairs for a phone I never received. Google decided that they won't refund because they replaced the phone, I believe that is a change of the terms and unfair after a written agreement.  Has anyone any advice? I'd like my $151.90 back. 

05/30/2020 phone stopped working
06/11/2020 shipped my phone to you
06/17/2020 I paid $151.90 for repairs, which I was told I would be refunded
6/17/2020 you shipped it back to me but IT NEVER ARRIVED, Fedex: 128638242133
FedEx told me Google has to make a claim
08/05/2020 - replacement phone sent out. 

Case ID [8-19460000******] - Mon, Jun 15, 7:41 PM
Hi Ronan,
Thank you for contacting Google Support Team. This email is in reference to the chat we had today regarding repair order. I would request you to go ahead and make payment for your repair order. As you have used Google Packaging to send your repair order complete refund for your device will be processed. Once you receive your repair order just reply to my email, I will assist you with the refund for this order. If you have any further query or questions please reply to my email, I will be happy to assist you further. Thank you for your patience and understanding.
